title: Tyson Fury lifts lid on Frank Warren's furious reaction to Gypsy King's WWE debut

Tyson Fury has revealed promoter Frank Warren wasn't happy when he found out the Gypsy King was going to compete in WWE.

Warren had no idea of Fury's plans until, like the rest of the world, he saw Fury's altercation with Braun Strowman on TV.

Fury will take on Strowman at Crown Jewel in Saudi Arabia in his debut in the WWE ring before a rematch with Deontay Wilder early next year.

And Warren was concerned Fury could suffer an injury that could jeopardise the clash with Wilder.

“That’s true, I wanted it to be a big surprise," Fury told the ESPN MMA show of Warren only finding out after watching on television. "He was mad, quite p****d to be fair.

(Image: PA)

“He said to me, ‘I think this is a really bad idea, you could get injured. Braun Strowman is a massive guy. What happens if the cut reopens? What happens if you get injured shoulders or legs or whatever?’

“I said, ‘What happens if I go out the front door and get run over by a bus in the morning?’

“If we lived our lives on ‘what if’ we would never do anything in our lives.

“I think you gotta take the bull by the horns and get up there and enjoy it because, like I say, this is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity.”
description: Fury will take on Braun Strowman at WWE Crown Jewel - but his promoter was less than impressed at the news
